page.title: 08A LOCAL FARM
page.content: We went to a local farm to ask about their land.We drove down a short track into the farmyard,which was paved with small stones.When we knocked on the door of the farmhouse an elderly lady answered.The room behind her was dark,there was no carpet on the blue-brick floor. The farmer's wife showed us to the farmer,after looking for a wandering muscovy duck.The farmer was wearing three hats,several jackets and an apron made of a sack.He led us to the cowshed,where eight cows were eating hay.After getting a clean bucket and three-legged stool,he sat down to milk his cow by hand. The farm has been split by a motorway and is now 52 acres of fairly rich pasture.We were very surprised by old fashioned it all seemed.
